borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal">The proposed
development would result in the loss of a substantial portion of external
amenity space for the residents and would result in the overdevelopment of the
plot which is considered unacceptable and harmful to the character of the
existing and original dwelling house. The addition will further erode
the&nbsp;built form and character of the dwelling house, terrace and the
Becontree Estate. The impact on the character of the Becontree Estate
identified adds&nbsp;further weight to the harm caused by this development. The proposal is contrary to:</p><p class="MsoNormal">- The National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG 2019);<br>- Policies 7.1,
7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of The London Plan (March 2016)<br>- Policies HC1, D1 and D4 of the
Draft&nbsp;London Plan Intend to Publish (December 2019)<br>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Core Strategy DPD
(July 2010)<br>- Policies BP2 and BP11 of&nbsp;the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policies
DM11, DM14, DM16 and SP4 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, November 2019)<br>- The
Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012).<o:p></o:p></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed development will cause unacceptable&nbsp;loss of outlook and daylight, cause unacceptable overshadowing and overbearing including an unacceptable sense of enclosure for the neighbouring residents of No.107 Arnold Road. This is contrary to:</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of&nbsp;the Local Development Framework Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policy&nbsp;DM16 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, November 2019)<br></span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012)</span></p>
description: Construction of a single storey rear extension.
